Package assemAssist

Class Company

java.lang.Object
assemAssist.Company
All Implemented Interfaces:
TaskObserver
public class Company extends Object implements TaskObserver
The Company class represents the company that offers products in the Catalogue, and manages the orders of the customers in the production scheduler, keeps track of the statistics of the company, and notifies the observers of the tasks that are completed. It has a list of all the completed orders.

      public Company() throws IllegalConstraintException

    • getOrdersFromGarageHolder

      public List<CarOrder>[] getOrdersFromGarageHolder(String name)
      Returns an array specific to the given garage holder consisting of two elements. The first element is a list of CarOrders that are pending. The second element is a list of CarOrders that are completed. The first element is sorted by the estimated completion date (most recent first). The second element is sorted by the completion date (most recent first).
      Parameters:
      name - the garage holder to get the pending and completed CarOrders for
      Returns:
      set of CarOrders that are pending or completed and ordered by the given garage holder
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given name is null or empty or if only whitespace is given

    • getOrderDetails

      public ArrayList<String> getOrderDetails(int ID, String garageHolder) throws OrderNotFoundException
      Returns a list consisting of strings. For a pending CarOrder, these are the specifications, the timestamp of ordering and the estimated production time. For completed orders, these are the specifications, the timestamp of ordering and the timestamp of completion.
      Parameters:
      ID - the id of the order of which the details will be returned
      garageHolder - the garage holder who ordered the order belonging to the given ID
      Returns:
      set of CarOrders that are pending or completed and ordered by the given garage holder
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given ID is not strictly positive or if the given garage holder is null or if the given garage holder is empty or if only whitespace is given
      OrderNotFoundException

    • getAvailableModels

      public HashSet<String> getAvailableModels()
      Returns a set of model names that are offered by the company.
      Returns:
      set of model names that are offered by the company

    • getWorkingTimeWorkingStation

      public int getWorkingTimeWorkingStation(String modelName) throws IllegalModelException

      Parameters:
      modelName - The name of the car model.
      Returns:
      The standard task time for the given car model.
      Throws:
      IllegalModelException

    • selectModel

      public TreeMap<String,HashSet<String>> selectModel(String model) throws IllegalModelException
      Returns a map of components and their respective offered options for the given modelName.
      Parameters:
      model - the name of the model to get the map of components and their respective offered options for from the catalog
      Returns:
      map of components and their respective offered options for the given modelName
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given model is null or if the given model is empty or if only whitespace is given
      IllegalModelException - if the given model is not offered by the company

    • getStatistics

      public List<String> getStatistics(int fromXLastDays)
      Returns the statistics of the company from the last time it was updated following the given number of days.
      Parameters:
      fromXLastDays - the number of days to get the statistics from (the statistics are updated every day)
      Returns:
      statistics of the company from the last time it was updated following the given number of days
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given number of days is negative

    • completeOrderingForm

      public String completeOrderingForm(TreeMap<String,String> chosenOptions, String garageHolder, String chosenModel) throws IllegalCompletionDateException, IllegalConstraintException, IllegalModelException, OptionThenComponentException, OptionAThenOptionBException, RequiredComponentException
      Function that accepts a map of specifications, a garage holder name, and a chosen car type. The function generates a new order for the garage holder with the given specifications and adds it to the production queue.
      Parameters:
      chosenOptions - the specifications of the car to order (the specifications must be valid)
      garageHolder - the garage holder to order the car for (the garage holder must be valid)
      chosenModel - the type of car to order (the chosen model must be valid) The function returns the estimated completion time of the order in the format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss".
      Returns:
      the estimated completion time of the order in the format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss".
      Throws:
      IllegalCompletionDateException - if the completion date is invalid
      IllegalConstraintException - if there exist constraints not following the correct syntax.
      IllegalModelException - if the chosen model is not offered by the car manufacturer.
      OptionThenComponentException - if there is an option specified but not the implied component.
      OptionAThenOptionBException - if there is an option specified but not the implied option(s).
      RequiredComponentException - if there is a required component not specified.

    • update

      public void update(int time)
      Updates the observer when a task is finished.
      Specified by:
      update in interface TaskObserver
      Parameters:
      time - the time the task was finished. (the time must be valid)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given time is negative
